Original question: The online comic strip xkcd.com has a “random” button one can click to choose one of the previous n ≈ 2400 strips. Assume there are exactly 2400 numbered strips and that clicking the “random” button yields the kth strip, where k is chosen uniformly from {1, 2, . . . , n}. If one observes 38 strips this way, what is the probability that one sees at least one strip more than once?
